main event: Three ships in the Atlantic Ocean sighted an illuminated, irregular, glowing and pulsing object that moved at an irregular speed and direction.
interesting points: The object was visible to 300 degrees at an approximate altitude of 60 degrees.
The object started to fall in altitude to 30 degrees.
The object's movement and appearance were described as unusual and not a normal astronomical phenomenon.
Other ships in the same area also observed the object.
The object eventually disappeared in the eastern sky after an unusual maneuver.
sighted object: An illuminated, irregular, glowing and pulsing object
